intro: Sesamum microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited sesame, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pedaliaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Ghana. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are the primary economic product of the species. The seeds are rich in oil and are used in both culinary and industrial applications. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
